page.title: 16EVENTS IN THE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The{Village Hall}was built in 1911 for the Oddfellows Society and purchased by the village in 1956 with funds raised by villagers. Today it is self-supporting with trustees and a Committee of Management.{Revenues}come from hiring, fund raising, socials and public grants enabling recent improvements to be made including a new toilet extension and conversion of the adjoining old carpenter's shop into a smaller meeting room. The Hall is used regularly for badminton, the Women's Institute, an over sixties club, amateur dramatics, Sunday school, Parish and Parochial Church Council meetings and public and private village functions. The Village Hall is an important centre of Swinford village life.
